Name: CreditManagement
Comments: Loan application data are uploaded to this system.
Description/Use:
The Credit Management Application (CMA) is a replacement for a series of MS Access databases used by the Kiwibank Credit team.ÊIt is a tool used by Credit ManagementÊstaff~ and made up of the following three separate components:
1.ÊDLA Ð Delegated Lending Authority details for Lenders
2.ÊQuality Ð Review and scoring of the ÒQualityÓ ofÊ lending deals referred to Credit Managers
3.ÊHindsight Ð Review and scoring of the previously approved deals by Credit Managers
The CMA is used daily by the Credit team to primarily review the quality of referred deals to Credit Managers. On a monthly basis all approved deals from prior month are reviewed using the Hindsight function. The DLA component is generally used by staff if required to check lending limits when undertaking Quality and Hindsight tasks.
Note: There will be some management reporting from the CMA that will be developed in due course (separate workstream)
System Details
The system is madeÊup of:A smart client desktop application developed by Danny Siew~ IT Applications Developer.New SQL Server database (CreditManagement_db) created by theÊApplication Delivery Team.New data feeds created to supply the new CreditManagement Db with Activate lending data via DataStaging.
Note: Refer to IT Diagrams for more info.
Database FeedsKB Activate data is scheduled to move from Staging to CMA three times a day Ð 9am~ 12 noon and 4pm business daysPL Activate data is scheduled to move from Staging to CMA once per day - 4pm business days
User Access
Business users of CMA will refer to CMA Administrator Ð Senior Credit Manager or Credit Business Analyst for access and allocation of ÔroleÕ levels with the CMA.
Ê
Business Process: used for hindsighting and quality reporting for lending ( from Activate )

Name: DocCollect
Comments: No information available
Description/Use:
Electronic Trade Document Collection Service (Ôthe SystemÓ) is a web-enabled export document collection solution provided by Citibank~ Singapore Branch (ÒCitibankÓ) and
powered by Trustcopy Pte Ltd that accepts documents from any electronic document preparation solution to be presented electronically to Citibank under Letters of Credit..

The System is accessed via CitibankÕs Corporate Internet Banking at https://www.asia.citibank.com/singapore/corporate.

The process used is that a document is scanned and placed into a folder on the users PC.
Software supplied by Citi is required to be downloaded onto the users PC with the purpose of converting the document file from a general format (.jpg or .doc or .xls formats for example) into the encrypted format. Once the user complete this step~ the documents are then uploaded into DocCollect and forwarded to Citi for processing.

The products supported by the system are Export Letter of Credits with relatively low volumes processed (3 per week) with the customer being exporters with a requirement to obtain payment for goods sent overseas.
Business Process:
Process existing Trade Finance  requests  - Loans and Letters of Credit (lcs)

Description/Use:
Specials Answers are for customers who have asked for a cheque to be cleared. When a customer requests a Special Answer~ the branch will complete a special answer form and fax it~ with a copy of the cheque~ to Support Services who will input the details into the automated Special Answer system then forward the request to the paying bank.

This system has two parts:
GQ Special Answers 
gRobot

Name: NzClear
Business Owner: Business Markets~ Treasury and Intl Operations
Description/Use: "NZClear is a RBNZ owned system. NZClear is used for the following tasks:   To view and manage KiwibankÕs ESAS account~ Buy and Sell NZD denominated~ Securities. Issue Kiwibank short dated discounted securities~ Settlement of some of Kiwibank NZD cash obligations~ Holds our portfolio of NZD denominated securities~ Settlement of SBI transactions under 3LC conditions (future state under SBI from early 2012. 3LC can be invoked by Kiwibank or another bank)~ Note: 3LC refers to the use of NZ Clear for file transfer and settlement~ in the event that SWIFT services~ Kiwibanks SWIFT connectivity or RBNZ SWIFT connectivity is unavailable. It is also the only means through which Kiwibank Treasury and support staff can view the Kiwibank ESAS account in real time.  NZ Clear has been enhanced to allow the sending bank to upload interchange files into the NZ Clear system (prior to Cash P or R entered)~ and the receiving bank to download the interchange file (after Cash P or R).  Accordingly~ this provides a solution for both file interchange and settlement.  Operational Processes~ The Interbank Wash-up is an absolute essential~ performed daily between 7.00 am and 8.30 am. Usually takes approx. 1.30 hrs for the Treasury Operations team to settle. Cut-off for NZClear is 8.30am sharp. Treasury Operations team receive a fax and email from EDS with the list of transactions via the banking network. Treasury Operations then use NZClear to enter these transactions. Note: This reflects the current state~ not as it will be under SBI.  Under SBI~ overnight processing is no longer routed through EDS.  Settlement will be on a gross bilateral basis via SWIFT.  The ÒWash-upÓ period will still exist but more so for the banks to attempt to square up their accounts at the Reserve Bank to levels they are happy with rather than the settlement of retail flow based transactions.  There are 6 PCs with a dedicated IP address to the Reserve Bank. Four in the Treasury Operations team~ and two from Wholesale IT. Plus 2 PCs at the Treasury/Treasury Support BCP site on level 12 of Radio New Zealand House. Each PC has its own static IP address to enabled it to pass through the kiwibank firewall to access to reserve Bank NZClear system via a common IP address."
Business Process: Collateral Management

Name: OBRProcessing
Comments:
Open Bank Resolution is a Reserve Bank initiative designed to open the bank for business on the next business day after its temporary closure following an insolvency event or an event that triggered putting it under statutory management.  The bank will be able to provide customers with full or partial access to their accounts and other bank services with little interruption.
During the temporary closure~ customersÕ accounts may be frozen and the Statutory Manager will determine the funds required to meet the bankÕs obligations to the industry.  This amount will be transferred to accounts under the control of the Statutory Manager and the remainder then unfrozen and available to customers the following day.
A condition of registration as a bank (from June 2013) is to be pre-positioned for this funds freeze event if it is required.

Components and Functionality
The OBR process brings together existing functionality~ updates to existing extracts to add additional transaction information and the development of a database. This database~ Tabatha~ will store the extracted transaction information~ calculate funds freeze values and provide update files to the different transaction systems.
Description/Use:
Open Bank Resolution is a Reserve Bank initiative designed to open the bank for business on the next business day after its temporary closure following an insolvency event or an event that triggered putting it under statutory management.Ê The bank will be able to provide customers with full or partial access to their accounts and other bank services with little interruption.
During the temporary closure~ customersÕ accounts may be frozen and the Statutory Manager will determine the funds required to meet the bankÕs obligations to the industry.Ê This amount will be transferred to accounts under the control of the Statutory Manager and the remainder then unfrozen and available to customers the following day.
A condition of registration as a bank (from June 2013) is to be pre-positioned for this funds freeze event if it is required.

Components and Functionality
The OBR process brings together existing functionality~ updates to existing extracts to add additional transaction information and the development of a database. This database~ Tabatha~ will store the extracted transaction information~ calculate funds freeze values and provide update files to the different transaction systems.
An Operations Manual has been developed for this process and will be held securely. The individuals involved in this process will be provided with the relevant portion of the manual during any testing and if this event ever occurs. The complete manual would be available to the GM that co-ordinates such an event and a hard copy will be held by the Risk team in a secure location.
This process will be tested twice yearly? And any updates to the Operations Manual arising from the test will be made. The manual has been created by the Core and Integration Delivery team and will be a joint responsibility between them and the FIST Operational Resilience team.
Key Steps in the Process (Summarised)
1.ÊStatutory Manager appointed/OBR invoked
2.ÊFreeze systems/isolate bank
3.ÊShut down access to Kiwibank systems
4.ÊFreeze VPS
5.ÊPrepare Ultracs for fund freeze
6.ÊRun International processes
7.ÊRun B2K processes
8.ÊRun Treasury/Wholesale processes
9.ÊPerform EOD/Start of Day for Ultracs
10.ÊLoad information into Tabatha
11.ÊCalculate funds freeze and populate output files
12.ÊApply funds freeze
13.ÊPerform reconciliations
14.ÊMove funds to OBR account
15.ÊPerform start of day
16.ÊUnfreeze systems/reopen bank

Name: Prepaid Application Processing System  (PAPS)
Comments:
Kiwibank Payment Services offer a range of prepaid card products:
The Prezzy VISA card is a non-embossed prepaid card that is accepted electronically at all VISA merchants.  Unlike a credit card it must have a credit balance before the customer can use the card. 
The Loaded VISA card is a non-embossed personalised prepaid card that is accepted at all electronic VISA merchants. As with the Prezzy Card and unlike a credit card~ the Loaded card must have a credit balance before it can be used; this card can be reloaded with additional funds over the life of the card.
Note: See VPS under Related Systems which is the new prepaid cards platform for newly issued Prezzy and Loaded cards (from Dec 2011)~ and for all Loaded for Travel and Christmas Visa cards.

PAPS is the repository where application data goes into; Prezzy cards do not feed into PAPS only loaded cards.PAPS selects the status of the application dependant on application information such as identification provided and fees paid.  Once an application is in a particular status~ the application will go to eFunds who return information whether an account has been created or not.

There are three sources for applications (for new Loaded cards~ addition of new cardholders) that exist for PAPS:

Datamail 
Secure Website (https://www.loadedcard.co.nz/) 
Manually directly into PAPS by the Payment Services~ Service Delivery Team
Processing of applications (new~ additional~ supplementary (identification checks)~ website and Sharepoint maintenance) all occur through the web services layer.  As part of the Change Management process~ any changes to PAPS must be flowed into MIS.
Description/Use:
Kiwibank Payment Services offer a range of prepaid card products:The Prezzy VISA card is a non-embossed prepaid card that is accepted electronically at all VISA merchants.Ê Unlike a credit card it must have a credit balance before the customer can use the card.The Loaded VISA card is a non-embossed personalised prepaid card that is accepted at all electronic VISA merchants. As with the Prezzy Card and unlike a credit card~ the Loaded card must have a credit balance before it can be used; this card can be reloaded with additional funds over the life of the card.
Note: See VPS under Related SystemsÊwhich isÊthe new prepaid cards platform for newly issued Prezzy and Loaded cards (from Dec 2011)~ and for allÊLoaded for Travel and ChristmasÊVisa cards.
PAPS is the repository where application data goes into;ÊPrezzy cards do not feed into PAPS only loaded cards.
Reload refers to Loaded VISA card.
PAPS selects the status of the application dependant on application information such as identification provided and fees paid.Ê Once an application is in a particular status~ the application will go to eFunds who return information whether an account has been created or not.
There are three sources for applications (for new Loaded cards~ addition of new cardholders) that exist for PAPS:DatamailSecure Website (https://www.loadedcard.co.nz/)Manually directly into PAPS by the Payment Services~ Service Delivery Team
Processing of applications (new~ additional~ supplementary (identification checks)~ website and Sharepoint maintenance) all occur through the web services layer.Ê As part of the Change Management process~ any changes to PAPS must be flowed into MIS.
Customers can submit their paper based applications through the NZ Post network~ all paper based applications are sorted and scanned Datamail~ this scanned data is then sent and captured into PAPS in three daily files. This is achieved using the KiwiBank FDS system.
All internet applications are captured directly by PAPS.
PAPS creates a file containing applications with a certain status~ this file is sent to eFunds to capture the customer and balance details~ eFunds liaise with Eyede to get the cards created and sent to the customer.
Fundamentally~ PAPS provides a number of integration and maintenance services~ comprising the following components:PAPS DatabaseMiddleware web serviceseFunds / Datamail Windows ServicesSharepoint maintenance and query site (http://reloadable)FDS Ð File distribution service (3 times per day)MIS (1 per day)
The PAPS database resides on KBPDSQLCRM01.
The middleware layer resides on 10.4.1.94~ under C:\Program Files\New Zealand Post Financial Services\Middleware Layer\2.0\Ver1.40\WebServices\CBI_2007060 folder
The eFunds and Datamail Windows ServicesÊ reside on fswndntbiz01 (10.4.1.79)~ under C:\Program Files\New Zealand Post Financial Services\PAPS\Datamail Listener
C:\Program Files\New Zealand Post Financial Services\PAPS\EFunds Handler folders
The basic sharepoint site resides on kbpdspoint02;Ê kbpdsqlcrm01 is also used for the storage of sharepoint configuration~ asp.net customisation and so on.
The Datamail files are transferred to Kiwibank via the KB FDS. The files are automatically transferred from FDS to PAPs for processing.

Name: RateSnapper
Comments:
Core Treasury application critical to Treasury day to day operations.
  
 Housed on a standalone pc in NZPH~ and noted as a key Treasury risk. There is a backup pc in RNZH Level 12 for interim redundancy~ but BCP planning will see an upgrade to this system to a newer 'Rates Engine' with better redundancy.
Description/Use: Foreign Exchange rate appplication on PC used for day to day operations.ÊÊ

Name: Reuters
Comments:
Core Treasury system used in the Treasury Dealer room.
 
Reuters provides information and trading services for FX and money markets. Treasury use Reuters/RMDS for market rates.
 
At 4.30pm the Reuters EOD market rates are loaded into Quantum and Qrisk via the rate snapper programme - residing on the EOD batch PC. The rate snapper process ensures the EOD market rates are uploaded into the TMS.
Description/Use:
Core Treasury system used in the Treasury Dealer room.
 
Reuters provides information and trading services for FX and money markets. Treasury use Reuters/RMDS for market rates.
Business Process: Bank Liquidity Management (incl. Cash Forecasting & Funding)~ News~ rates for pricing.  EIKON front end for Dealers.

Name: Rightfax
Comments:
Application that creates soft copies of incoming faxes. 
 
Part of the Gen-i Managed Telephony Service~ the application sits on the Gen-i Rightfax server in Wellington (with a stanby one in Auckland). Amtel are the Third party vendor who Gen-i will deal with directly in resolving any issues.
 
Faxes come into the Rightfax gateway from a number of sources~ and usually relate to customer requests.
Description/Use:
Application that creates soft copies of incoming faxes. 
 
Part of the Gen-i Managed Telephony Service~ the application sits on the Gen-i Rightfax server in Wellington (with a stanby one in Auckland). Amtel are the Third party vendor who Gen-i will deal with directly in resolving any issues.
 
Faxes come into the Rightfax gateway from a number of sources~ and usually relate to customer requests.
 
The Rightfax gateway checks the fax source and based on pre-determined data~ distributes these into a specified mailbox~ monitored by different KB business teams. eg:
- SSFaxes@kiwibank.co.nz
- Priority.Faxes@kiwibank.co.nz
- Followup@kiwibank.co.nz
Business Process: Keeping critical Post Shops open for KB transactions

Name: Scanning And image Management System (SAMS)
Comments:
A system for managing the scanning of customer forms/document types such as AP's~ AOA's~ and insurance documents~ into Kiwibank IT systems. Provides scanning and uploading functionality~ verification~ reporting~ and viewing of scanned documents (via In Touch).
 
This system was designed as a replacement for the Star Wars suite of apps - Gedi~ Yoda~ and DocManager~ and to support  insurance document types in support of project Bancassurance.
 
Used primarily Support Services and Business Banking staff. Access to the SAMS application is via the Kiwibank desktop~ and In Touch for the document viewer.
Description/Use: A system for managing the scanning of customer forms/document types such as AP's~ AOA's~ and insurance documents~ into Kiwibank IT systems. Provides scanning and uploading functionality~ verification~ reporting~ and viewing of scanned documents (via In Touch).
Business Process: New loan documentation for Business  loans accepted prior to disruption

Name: SBI Monitor Application
Comments: Component of SBI Processing
Description/Use:
Developed by Payments Delivery~ the SBI monitor application displays SBI file alerts and other notifications to facilitate the settlement and liquidity management of the Kiwibank ESAS (Exchange Settlement Account System) account~ and to meet the SBI failure to settle rules and supplementary procedures.
Ê
Treasury Operations areÊthe primary users of this monitoring application (Mon-Fri 7am to 3am). The primary purpose of the application is to assist Treasury Operations to monitor their ESAS account.

It should be noted that ESAS is the primary source~ and the monitor is simply a tool to assist.
Ê
TechnicalThe application is hosted on an internal Kiwibank SharePoint site:http://integrate/sites/ITPayments/default.aspxThe service and database live on the mirrored pair of kbpdatmrec02 and kbpdatmrec01
Functionality of the Monitor Application:Displays status of incoming and outgoing SBI files in front-endProvides facility to load business/IT contacts/ Alert rules and mechanism of alertDisplays the SBI file alerts E.g. file remains unsettled~ critical file errors etc.Where applicable generates SBI file alerts to other internal parties~ e.g. Treasury (dealers)~ or various IT departments (shift ops) via email and e-texts.Provides facility to update bank state in front-endDisplays ESAS balances in front-endÐ Current~ forecast and total unsettled files balance
Throughout the process the incoming and outgoing file states will be updated on the monitor.ÊThe file states are as follows:QueuingValidationReformattingCore ProcessingImplements timeoutsActs on business rules triggering alerts and displays alerts/notifications
Ê
Business Process: Process Settlement Exceptions

Name: SecureMail
Comments:
Component of Internet Banking. A secure message system available to customers logged into Internet Banking. It provides a means for the customer to send information and questions directly to a KB staff member within a secure environment. Once the message is received~ Kiwibank commit to responding to the customer within 24 to 48 hours depending on the team and enquiry.
 
The application is built using Sharepoint and K2 workflows. It replaced an old Secure Mail system on 24 May 2011~ and was delivered under project KS0002A

Name: STB
Comments: Decommissioned in 2012
Description/Use:
*Decommissioned Jan 2012. FIST ended the contract with the vendor.
Ê
STB is a system used by the Fist team to detect money laundering.
Ê
Customer activity data is extracted from the Data warehouse overnight then loaded and processed by the STB system at 9am in the morning.
Ê
The Fist team analyse the results highlighted by STB of those that meet "pre-defined" conditions of potential fraudulent activity.
Ê
STB (SQL back-end) contains 1 years worth of data.

Name: SwiftAllianceAccess
Business Owner: Business Markets~ Treasury and Intl Operations
Description/Use:
Swift is a telegraphic transfer system used by all banks. Unlike CitiDirect which transfers to overseas accounts~ Swift is mostly used for transfers to NZ banks.
 
Swift is used for:
Processing of batches of financial transactions between NZ banks in support of Settlement and Interchange processing 
Large payments to other banks 
Sameday Cleared Payments (SCP) 
Paying NZ Post 
Paying CitiDirect 
Routes messages regarding settlement batches and balances to SBI Monitor Application.
Swift has internet VPN connectivity via Kiwibank Gateway servers to the Swift network. 
 
Biztalk automatically processes SCP messages.
 
The International team and Treasury Support interact with Swift directly to send and receive messages..
 
Swift acts as a message router~ no processing occurs at Swift except fee charging (to the banks that use the service).
Business Process: Collateral Management

Name: Tabatha
Comments: Tabatha is a stand-alone database~ user GUI and periphery processing solutions~ that will contain an extract of customer balances~ calculate the frozen account value and generate financial entries to effect a funds freeze in core systems in the event that Open Bank Resolution is invoked.
Description/Use:
Tabatha is a stand-alone database~ user GUI and periphery processing solutions~ that will contain an extract of customer balances~ calculate the frozen account value and generate financial entries to effect a funds freeze in core systems in the event that Open Bank Resolution is invoked. 
Ê
Components and Functionality
1.ÊDetermine customersÕ account balances~ on a per account basis~ according to specified rules and as of a cut-off time. OBR has introduced or modified the ability to extract customer balances from core system to a new database Ð Tabatha Ð that tracks the balance amount for each customer.
2.ÊApply funds freeze on customer balances as directed by the statutory manager~ with the de minimis option (funds exempt from freezing)Ê if required~ within a time frame of less than 24 hours. Tabatha will generate financial entries that will be fed back into core systems to debit customer accounts and transfer the frozen value to an account controlled by the Statutory Manager.
3.ÊRetain the details for each customer of the amount frozen in Tabatha. Tabatha will generate refunds to customers of the frozen funds on advice from the Statutory Manager. This activity would likely occur at some time later than funds freeze~ e.g. months later. Tabatha has the ability to provide multiple refunds. Tabatha will generate financial entries that will be fed back into core systems to credit customer accounts and transfer the frozen value from an account controlled by the Statutory Manager.

Name: Visitor Management System
Comments:
The new 2012 Visitor Management Application~ developed internally~ enables Kiwibank to manage visitors to the buildings where the system is installed. It also allows reception staff to manage temporary access cards for staff or contractors who require one.
 
A ÒvisitorÓ refers to a vendor~ guest of any onsite personnel~ service workers~ or anyone who needs to enter the facility for a short duration~ usually not more than one day.
Description/Use:
TheÊnew 2012 Visitor Management Application~Êdeveloped internally~Êenables Kiwibank to manage visitors to the buildings where theÊsystem is installed. It also allows reception staff to manage temporary access cards for staff or contractors who require one.
Ê
A ÒvisitorÓ refers to a vendor~ guest of any onsite personnel~ service workers~ or anyone who needs to enter the facility for a short duration~ usually not more than one day.
Ê
It meetsÊrequirements relating to:PCI - ensuring access to sensitive information is managed appropriately~ and 3 months worth of visitor records available.Physical securityEmergency managementHealth and SafetyBusiness Continuity
Sign In Process
Every visitor mustÊsign-in using the screen provided (touch screen capability due soon)~ entering their name~ company~ and the person to whom they are visiting.
Ê
A label is then printed out from the laebl printer~ which they need to wear for as long as they remain onsite.
Ê
An email is also automatically sent to the host advising them their visitor is waiting at reception. This email also includes an instruction and linkÊtoÊsign the visitor out once they have left.
Ê
Sign Out Process
As soon as theÊvisitor has left the Kiwibank host should follow the link in the original email received to sign them out.ÊThe visitor themself does not have to sign out.
Ê
A reminder email is sent at 4pm to those staff who have not signed their visitors out.
Ê
At 12am / midnight the system determines which visitors have not been signed out. It builds an email listing details of staff who have not signed out their visitors. The email is then sent to the FIST inbox. All signed in visitors are then automatically signed out. (The system design is based on theÊassumption we will not have visitors onsite at midnight.)

Ê
Access Card Management
The admin screen allows reception staff to issue and manage temporary access cards to those staff who have misplaced theirs~ or to contractors working onsite etc. For more info see 'Visitor App Design.docx' (link under more info).

Ê
Brief Technical
The Visitor App is a two-tier application consisting of an MVC frontend / business logic layer and a primary database backend. 
The system relies on other external links out to:Active DirectoryThe Kiwibank SMTP serverThe local label printer
The frontend is delivered toÊvisitors via a screen connected to a locked down desktop pc. Kioware was purchased to enable ÊReception staff can administer the system using a connection to the application from their own pc's.
Buildings using the new VMS:NZ Post House:ÊDesktopÊnumber KBCORDFC71E5 (10.6.4.59)~ located at L1 reception under the desk~ and uses aÊDymo Labelwriter 400Êlabel printer.

Name: Voltron
Comments:
This application is used to reconcile CitiDirect and Travelex transactions.
 
The International team reconcile the Postshop and Travelex transactions using this application developed by Andrew Olds.
This is a .NET application with a SQL database.
 
Files are received from Postlink overnight via FDS. Other files are either emailed or downloaded from the web by The international team~ and loaded into Data warehouse for extraction by the application.
 
* Schedule to be replaced by end of 2012 by the implementation of 'ProActiv' from Broadridge~ as part of the Reconciliations Project~ KB0303. See Payments Delivery for status updates.
